thread.title: Sergio Aguero can partner Gabriel Jesus up front at Manchester City, says Pep Guardiola
thread.title_full: Sergio Aguero can partner Gabriel Jesus up front at Manchester City, says Pep Guardiola

author: sstreet
title: Sergio Aguero can partner Gabriel Jesus up front at Manchester City, says Pep Guardiola
text:
It takes two Sergio Aguero can partner Gabriel Jesus up front at Manchester City, says Pep Guardiola 
City boss scoffs at rumours that Brazilian star's arrival will force Aguero to look for a new club By MARTIN BLACKBURN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PEP GUARDIOLA is still convinced Sergio Aguero can be a perfect match for Manchester City new-boy Gabriel Jesus. 
The sensational start made by the Brazilian teenager has led to question marks over the future of City’s top scorer. Reuters 7 The arrival of Gabriel Jesus had led to question marks over Sergio Aguero’s future 
Aguero, 28, was left on the bench on Wednesday while Jesus teamed up with Raheem Sterling and Leroy Sane to run West Ham ragged. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But Guardiola assured Aguero he remains pretty much the most important player at the Etihad. 
And Pep plans to shift Jesus out wide — a role his old club Palmeiras regularly used him in — to allow the Argentine to play down the middle. 
Sources close to Aguero indicated he is keen to stay at City and fight for his place, so Guardiola’s words will be encouraging. 
He said: “ Gabriel arrives, he played well and that’s why he was used at West Ham. But they can play together. New Man City star Gabriel Jesus shows off his dance moves in the snow 
“Individually, Gabriel can play on the left. Now I have many options. 
“In Brazil, Gabriel played on the left side — he likes to play on the left with the movement in diagonals — like he was doing in the last games. 
“Both can play together because Gabriel is not just one in behind, he is good in the box, he is a fighter. 
“His back-tracking is really good, that’s why he can help a lot.” Getty Images But Aguero is believed to want to stay at the Etihad and fight for his place Getty Images Pep Guardiola says there is room for both players in his team News Group Newspapers Ltd 7 The pair approach the ball at West Ham 
Aguero has 18 goals overall this season and has risen to third on the club’s all-time leading scorers list. 
And that comes less than six years after his arrival. 
The feeling persists that Guardiola wants more from the him but City’s boss insists the former Atletico Madrid forward is still a vital player in his plans. 
Guardiola added: “Sergio remains the squad’s most, or one of the most, important players. Related Stories mummy's boy Man City have their guardian angel in Gabriel Jesus... but he still needs his mum to help out GRAM A GRANNY Manchester City star Sergio Aguero's granny caught up in Buenos Aires drugs bust storm God's gift Gabriel Jesus' tattoo reminds Brazilian of amazing journey from the slums to Premier League sergi-off? Real Madrid in stunning plot to sign Manchester City's out-of-favour striker Sergio Aguero this summer Toure on Tour Yaya Toure added to Manchester City's Champions League squad along with new signing Gabriel Jesus Jesus fight Sergio Aguero vows to stay and battle for his place alongside new City hero Gabriel Jesus City slickers Gabriel Jesus and jubilant Manchester City team-mates laugh and hug each other in training after returning from 4-0 drubbing of West Ham 
“I understand the debate. But there is no doubt about Sergio’s quality. 
“Without him it will not be possible to achieve what we want. I can say how happy I am with what he did — except the seven games when he was banned. 
“The big clubs in Europe always have a lot of strikers — here there was Mario Balotelli, Carlos Tevez, Sergio and Edin Dzeko all together. 
“Sergio has played all the games except one in Barcelona for a tactical decision and one when he had come back from Argentina. 
“The others — when he was not banned — he always played good.” News Group Newspapers Ltd Edin Dzeko, Mario Balotelli and Carlos Tevez played together at Man City Richard Pelham City demolished West Ham in midweek Sportimage But goalkeeper Claudio Bravo was dropped to the bench 
Jesus has only played two full games for City but his enthusiasm has already impressed his boss. 
Pep said: “He’s 19 but he’s settled quickly. He speaks enough English words to understand us. He’s taking lessons every day. That means a lot. 
“In his three appearances he’s shown a lot in terms of desire, helped us with high-pressing intensity, his movement in the box.” New Manchester City chant about Gabriel Jesus takes a dig at Wayne Rooney 
Guardiola has another big call to make ahead of tomorrow’s clash with Swansea — but is expected to keep faith with Willy Caballero in goal. 
He axed Claudio Bravo, 33, after a difficult run but urges the Chilean not to give up on his City career. 
He said: “It depends on what I see. I am not a guy who plays the same 11 all the time for two months. 
“Claudio’s a huge professional with a lot of experience. I explained and he understood. He’s strong enough.”
